👋 Self-Introduction in German

Let’s learn how to introduce ourselves in simple German using “ich bin” and other structures.

1. Ich bin Rahul.
This means: I am Rahul.
ich bin = I am
You can replace 'Rahul' with your name.

2. Ich bin fünfzehn Jahre alt.
This means: I am 15 years old.
• fünfzehn = 15
• Jahre = years
• alt = old

3. Ich wohne in München.
This means: I live in Munich.
wohne is the verb ‘to live’.
in = in


Ich komme aus Neu-Delhi, Indien.
This means: I come from New Delhi, India.

4. Ich bin Studentin.
This means: I am a student.
‘Studentin’ is used for females. Males would say ‘Student’.

5. Ich spreche Englisch und Deutsch.
This means: I speak English and German.
• spreche = speak
• und = and

6. Mein Hobby ist Fußball spielen.
This means: My hobby is playing football.
• Mein Hobby = my hobby
• ist = is
• Fußball spielen = to play football

✅ Well done!
You now know how to talk about yourself in German!
Try to make your own 4–5 line introduction using these examples.
